name: Cantor of Gruumsh - Bard 26 / Cleric 12 / Blackguard 2
author: TheSquid

posts.author: TheSquid
posts.content:
A paragon of merciless cruelty, this is a character that revels in pain and violence, and enjoys every bit of blood shed while composing odes to Gruumsh. Tried and tested on the World of Greyhawk PW server.

Features:
  • Bard 26 with full spellcasting and a potent Song/Curse song
  • Cleric spells up to level 6, for Divine Favor/Divine Power and Harm
  • Well-rounded fighting abilities, with Expertise+Taunt as icing on the cake
  • Very high buffed effective AB
  • Maximally efficient use of starting stat points :)
  • Scribe scrolls for nigh-infinite Harm casts
Disadvantages:
  • Low HP
  • Feats come late, with a whooping 3 pre-epic feats taken in epic levels
  • Abysmal unbuffed AB and damage

Comments, in the form of a made-up Q&A session:

Q: What is this character supposed to do?
A: She is a melee fighter. She is supposed to enter fights after casting (Extended) Bless, Aid, Divine Power, Divine Favor, War Cry and Song/Curse Song to reach the AB bonus cap. She can cast Harm/Heal including from self-scribed scrolls, for any enemy who cannot resist spells.

Q: A melee fighter with 34 AB? You’ve got to be kidding!
A: This character can easily reach the +20 cap on AB bonus, add to that +6 from capped STR from items and we get to 60. To that, add +6 effective AB from Curse Song and another +6 from very-hard-to-resist Taunt, and we get an effective 72 AB. Not so bad, huh?

Q: I am intrigued, tell me more stats.
A: Gladly!
  • Damage (mundane scimitar): 1d6 +5+6 (STR) +1d6+6 (Darkfire) +4 (Divine Favor) +2 (Song) +5 (GMW) = 2d6+28, crit 12-20x2
  • AC: 30 (plate & shield) + 25 (+5 bonuses) +6 (Song) +4 (Haste) +2 (effective from Curse Song) +2 (cap DEX) +1 (Mage Armor) = 70, can be improved with Expertise.
Q: Ok, but why on Oerth 2 Blackguard levels?
A: For saves and martial weapon proficiency, and not incurring any XP penalty. An alternative is 2 Fighter levels, which frees up up to 4 feats (dropping Cleave). Another option is Cleric 13 / Fighter 1 to open up Word of Faith, and yet another one is flat-out Cleric 15 / Bard 25. These are all valid alternatives, but different builds.

Q: Why not Divine Might and/or Divine Shield? It’s even thematically appropriate!
A: Assuming Haste is on, this character takes two rounds to buff up. Divine Favor lasts 20 rounds and Divine Power lasts 24 rounds, and non-Lasting Song lasts 10 rounds. Result: you need to rebuff quite often. Adding another full round of buffs that last 9 rounds each seemed to cross the “unplayable” line (not to mention the extreme tightness on feats). It is a pity, but sacrifices had to be made.

Q: How much Perform will I need from items if I play this?
A: You need 80 for level 26 Song, which means you are 24 short. If, however, you can get just +12 Perform from items (including CHA bonus), you can sing a level 23 Song for yourself and get the remaining +12 from it for Curse Song. So: 24 Perform for level 26 Song/Curse Song, or 12 Perform for level 23 Song/level 26 Curse Song.

Q: Is this build really better than a Bard 26 / RDD 10 / BG 4?
A: No. She reaches the same AB buffed as the RDD has unbuffed, give or take (which means that if e.g. +10 weapons and/or DP scrolls are available, the RDD is far better). The RDD has better HP, fire immunity, and 4 more AC. The RDD can make use of Divine Might/Shield, having only one short-term buff (Song). There are however two things that the Cantor does better:
  • Harm (including from scrolls) is massive. It is in my top 4 offensive spells in the game, even though in this case it will not pierce any kind of SR.
  • AB being equal, the RDD’s hasted progression is (say) +60/+55/+50/+45/+60, while the Cantor’s is +60/+55/+50/+60/+55. This is quite a noticeable difference, and somewhat compensates for her need to spend rounds re-buffing.
Overall I don’t think this is a stronger class combination, but Bard 26 / RDD 10 / BG 4 is one of the absolute best builds in NWN, so if this one comes close I’m not complaining.

Q: Has this been done before?
A: Of course, but not like this. I found these builds in the old archives and the forum:
  • Divine Melody - Cleric11 Bard23 CoT6: similar idea, Bard buffs are not undispellable, lower AB and lower saves (with a CHA buff). Has a very good DM and DS.
  • Devout songster - Cleric 13 Bard23 Fighter4: very similar, not undispellable, worse saves, XP penalty, but higher AB and level 7 spells.
  • Church Choir Singer - Cleric 16 Bard20 Fighter4: maybe the most similar in spirit, but chooses to get higher AB, AC and damage instead of saves, utility (Scribe and Still) and HP. I’m not a huge fan of DM and DS in this one, for the reasons I explained.
  • Happy Helper - Cleric 18 Bard 20 BG 2 and Ancilla - Cleric 17 Bard 20 Sorcerer 3: these are party-focused builds that would not reach high enough AB for my taste to be considered meleers.
  • Harbinger of Sorrow - Cleric 19 Bard 20 SD 1: this one is a weird dual caster with SF:Evocation. I love this kind of builds, but I would not choose Bard as one of my two casting classes. Have to try it out, I guess.
So there you are, enjoy Bard+Cleric power, and feel free to provide comments, suggestions, or questions regarding the build!

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
So, 1 dispel and everything is toast, right (mostly cleric side)?

How in the world did you even level this on WoG, where everything including it's dog casts dispel spam? O_o

Well, that must have been something!

On an aside, I like the Bard part alot.

posts.author: TheSquid
posts.content: You are right, the Cleric buffs are easily dispellable. You just recast them, you really only need DF+DP to function and those are short-lasting anyway. It was very smooth playing on WoG actually (and unexpectedly). Make sure to have a bag full of scrolls of GMW, Keen Edge, Darkfire (those are bad), DP for rainy days, and you're good to go!

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
A tested build with a very fine presentation. :)

My first thought was; why not cleric 15 with the +5 bonus to many buffs. But you answered that. You reach the cap anyhow. And there are not enough levels for 25-26 bard levels, 2 BG levels and 15 cleric levels in a lvl 40 build.
